project_descr: BRA/14/010 - “Brazil & Africa: fighting poverty and empowering women via South-South Cooperation”

outputs.output_descr: Increased capacities in African Low Income Countries (LICs) to promote gender equality and the empowerment of women and girls inspired by relevant Brazilian experiences.
Strengthened public policies planning in Mozambique through promotion of the MDGs 3 (gender equality and empower women),4 (reduce child mortality) and 5 (improve maternal health)

Outcome 1.	Increased and improved knowledge-sharing and learning in African Low Income Countries (LICs) on the design and implementation of social development/social protection programmes inspired by relevant Brazilian public policies

Improved Monitoring and Evaluation of social development/protection programmes in Mozambique as a result of technical capacity development supported by the project.
Outputs 1 and 2 (UN implementing partner – IPC-IG): 
These outputs are aimed at developing a Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) System for Social Protection in Mozambique and training high and mid-level technical staff regarding the main methodologies of M&E. 

Nigeria has championed various initiatives focusing on poverty alleviation, including the Multi-Partner Matching Funds (MP-MF), the Care of the People (COPE) Cash Transfer Prog

Project governance and follow-up ensured

Output 1 (UN implementing partner - UNDP): 
This output refers to the project governance, which shall be ensured by UNDP as leading UN Agency in this project. Activities includes project coordination and follow-up but including a mission with the participation of ABC as coordinating Agency for the Brazilian Government.
